body_text:
Note: This is a PR against the backports branch, not master. The backports branch is not going to be merged to master.
This PR does three things in two commits

Backports @brittanystoroz's PR #125 so we can get the sweet sweet goodness of only making one CDN request on the selfrepair page. (commit 1)
Removes all of Pipeline, since we aren't going to use it long term, and it gets in the way of the webpack work. (commit 2, part 1)
Removes the vestigial Control modules, since it isn't in use in the branch, and it was using Pipeline. We'll have a new, webpacked version in the future, courtesty of @brittanystoroz. (commit 2, part 2)

I think this is the simplest way to get this to a point we can deploy it without breaking everything.
@brittanystoroz r?

  • Removes the vestigial Control modules, since it isn't in use in the branch, and it was using Pipeline. We'll have a new, webpacked version in the future, courtesty of @brittanystoroz. (commit 2, part 2)

I think this is the simplest way to get this to a point we can deploy it without breaking everything.

@brittanystoroz r?
title: Bring in webpack bundling and make it work.
body:
Note: This is a PR against the backports branch, not master. The backports branch is not going to be merged to master.

This PR does three things in two commits
- Backports @brittanystoroz's PR #125 so we can get the sweet sweet goodness of only making one CDN request on the selfrepair page. (commit 1)
- Removes all of Pipeline, since we aren't going to use it long term, and it gets in the way of the webpack work. (commit 2, part 1)
- Removes the vestigial Control modules, since it isn't in use in the branch, and it was using Pipeline. We'll have a new, webpacked version in the future, courtesty of @brittanystoroz. (commit 2, part 2)

I think this is the simplest way to get this to a point we can deploy it without breaking everything.

@brittanystoroz r?
